dublin_core.dcvalue: Mark Ansermino, Senior Associate Clinician Scientist and Director of the Innovations in Acute Care & Technology, CFRI, Email: part@cw.bc.ca | Kristen Yee, Associate Program Manager, Grand Challenges Canada, Email: kristen.yee@grandchallenges.ca

PIERS works to prevent deadly complications of pre-eclampsia using a mobile phone predictive model system that can accurately stratify women into risk categories up to one week before complications arise. CHWs can use the system to provide referrals and treatment advice for pre-eclampsia and transmit information to referral centers for coordination of triage, transportation and treatment.

Saving Lives at Birth Grand Challenge partners, USAID, the Government of Norway, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Grand Challenges Canada, and the World Bank
Pre-Eclampsia Integrated Estimate Of Risk On The Move
sensors and point-of-care diagnostics, electronic decision support, provider-to-provider communication, Child Health, Maternal Health
